titleStmt.title: W. P. Anderson, Special Orders, No. 37
CWG11496

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.collection: 45th, 47th, 48th, and 49th Regiments Kentucky Infantry Muster Rolls

body.p:
Department of the Ohio,
ASSISTANT ADJUTANT GENERAL'S OFFICE,
Lexington, Kentucky, February 6th, 1864.
Special Orders,
No. 37
[Extract.]

3,, The resignation of 2nd, Lieutenant, Noah Johnson Co, "B" 40th Ky. Volunteers for the good of the Service is hereby accepted, to take effect Febry 6" 1864, with the condition that he shall receive no final payments until he exhibits satisfactory evidence from the head of the Ordnance Department, and the proper accounting officers of the Treasury, that he has made all prescribed returns, and is in no wise indebted to the Government.

By Command of Major General Foster:
W P Anderson
Assistant Adjutant General.

40 Infy
Johnson Noah
2' Lieut. Coy B.
Resignation
accepted for the good of the service.
Recd at A. G. O. Feby 8. 1864
